item.title: Disable charging of a Nokia N900 while USB connected.
item.description: One of the joys of having a hackable computer serving as a phone is that you can do stuff which have no “option” in “settings”. Recently I wanted to see if I can connect it to an Android tablet (Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1). I couldn’t. Too bad as I could really use the extra 32Gb the n900 has to offer. It would connect but the tablet disconnects it as soon as the phone tries to start charging.

item.title: Working mediatomb config.xml for Samsung UE37C5000
item.description: I have a NAS and an Samsung UE37C5000 UPNP/DLNA enabled led TV. Streaming from the first to the second should be easy, right? Well after a few tweaks MediaTomb makes it possible. I don’t say this is the best configuration possible but it’s the one that works INCLUDING pause and fast forwarding. Relevant from the default are the custom header, extended protocol info and the mkv and avi lines. MediaTomb uuid:0f53d0ff-5951-4d27-8fa7-06ce378ae789 /var/lib/mediatomb /usr/share/mediatomb/web mediatomb.

item.title: Bad image quality from HDMI connected PC to Samsung LED LCD
item.description: So, we finally upgraded our old CRT TV to a newer, Full HD Samsung LCD TV (ue37c5000). Since we have a media-center PC the first thing I did was of course hook it up and test a few full hd clips to enjoy the new TV. Everything was nice and well until I switched the tv from the VGA cable I had lying around to a HDMI cable I just bought.
